website_summaries.verdict: The sleek look of this splurge-worthy soda making machine is reminiscent of ones used in old soda shops.
pros: Version II has improved internal features

customer_reviews.title: Please make glass bottles!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking and sturdy, works great. Switched from the other brand to upgrade the look and feel of my carbonator. BUT then I am still forced to use cheap plastic bottles. (Tried a glass SS bottle and did not fit.) I'd like to upgrade my entire beverage experience and this piece is missing. Please consider closing the creative and aesthetic loop on this design and make glass bottles for the machine. Your customers will gladly pay for the privilege :)
customer_reviews.author: Ali L.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t look like the photo
customer_reviews.text: The color is not brass. It an orange metallic color. So cheap looking. It looks nothing like the beautiful soft brass color in the photo on Amazon or on the box when it arrived. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: melimela

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very slim and sleek design. Matches perfectly with my modern style kitchen. I use to own a sodastream and love that i can also use the same tank for this product as well. I highly recommend this for all you soda lovers trying to save some money. Those $5 club sodas add up. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Spencer

customer_reviews.title: The point was bubbles
customer_reviews.text: Not even mineral water bubbles after repeat blasts . Soda stream is much better
customer_reviews.author: Cc

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really loving this machine! It is super simple and very fun to operate. I love how I can choose how much gas I want to carbonate the water with as my tastes tend to vary daily! I can honestly say it has me drinking twice as much water. Additionally the machine is absolutely gorgeous, it looks amazing on my countertop and feels very solid!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the first generation, which broke shortly after I received it. The sellers were very quick to replace it with the second generation model. This one is definitely sturdier without any major changes to the aesthetics. The carbonators seem to last longer than with the first generation. So far I’ve been very happy with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Villalon

customer_reviews.title: This Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Received 1st one and it never worked properly leaked the Co2. Received Replacement yesterday and it won't Carbonate. So wanted for this to work so much better looking than the alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: fuzedup2

customer_reviews.title: Gasket failures over and over
customer_reviews.text: One might get 10 to 20 bottles out of this before replacing canister after canister and then discovering that the gasket is there but still leaks. So my attempts not to buy disposable plastic failed. Cannot recommend. I have spent more time trying to fix this versus drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: alexinchicago

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works great, easy to understand, sturdy. Ive been using mine multiple times a day for a few weeks. It makes great carbonation. A tad pricey, but for the amount I was paying for just buying 8 liters of carbonated water a week, including the cost for gas bottles it will take about 6 months to pay for itself. After that its a real money saver not to mention repeat trips to the store lugging heavy bottles. Really like the bottles. I pack two for work every day, no spill, perfect size. I would recommend this to a friend for sure. I add the Stur flavorings & electrolyte drops to kick it up a notch.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Pretty but very poorly constructed. After only a few weeks we noticed it was not carbonating the water well and air was just leaking out of the top of the carbonator. After a month it’s comoletely useless :(
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a piece of art rather than a soda machine, this is it!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful machine!! Looks great in my kitchen, but I could produce more fizz by blowing bubbles with a straw. It also leaks water onto the countertop from some unknown source. I am returning it and going back to good old reliable SodaStream.
customer_reviews.author: Circa1952

customer_reviews.title: Better bubbles
customer_reviews.text: We made a conscious decision and o eleiminate sodas a few years ago, but wanted something to spice up water. This is the trick!! Bubbles and then some fun flavors - or no flavors at all and just enjoy the bubbles!! So easy to use and adds a great amount of carbonation!! Looks great in my kitchen too. It is a substantial and well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only four 4 CO2 cartridges then LEAKED
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks good which is the only positive thing I can say for it. I never got more than 25 liters of fizzy water and I was only using 3 - 4 shots of gas. Now it leaks so badly it blows CO2 into to the bottle when the lever is NOT being engaged. DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Stylish upgrade from Sodamaster
customer_reviews.text: This device compliments my bar area and does a great job. I would strongly suggest you buy extra bottles from Aarke. While sodamaster bottles will fit, the Aarke bottles are bigger, hold about 2.5 times as much sparkling water and are attractive. You will notice that you need additional 60l carbonation gas bottles because, while it doesn’t use more gas, the Aarke bottles are larger. Therefore, expect to replace the gas more often, though it provides a better level of carbonation than sodamaster.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ganem III

customer_reviews.title: Best carbonator machine  available.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is absolutely beautiful, and extremely well-made. It should last a lifetime. Absolutely no carbonation leaking anywhere when it’s being used. My only complaint about it might be that it is pricey, but it’s well worth it. I was getting tired of getting a new machine every few years, because they quit working well, and started leaking a lot of gas when being used. Could not be more pleased, plus it looks great in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: vwr

customer_reviews.title: looks cool
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of the unit. I ordered some extra soda stream bottles and they fit fine. Nice to not have to lug water from the store.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit more expensive than some brands on the market but we thought it was worth it since it looks like a solid piece of technology sitting out on the counter and had more stars than some of the less expensive competitors. We have used this for nearly 8 months now and have had no troubles. We love the appearance. It uses the standard SodaStream bottles which are widely available (we get ours locally since an exchange for the empty bottle is required to avoid repaying a new deposit).
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Consumer

customer_reviews.title: This Carbonator is Junk
customer_reviews.text: This carbonator stopped working after the fourth 60 liter CO2 bottle. Do not purchase this item you will be disappointed. It looks good on the outside but stops working soon after you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing for a $200 soda maker
customer_reviews.text: The Aarke looks great and it worked, for two bottles of CO2. Now, when I carbonate a bottle CO2 rushes out the bottom. My first CO2 cylinder took 2 weeks to finish. Now I finish a bottle in 3 days. I have emailed Aarke support for a solution. I will update this review, pending customer service. For now, I cannot recommend purchasing at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Matten

customer_reviews.title: Bottle bottom broke off instantly
customer_reviews.text: The actual machine is lovely, works as designed and cleans well too. The bottle that comes with the machine is special to fit the top connector so the carbonation works appropriately- tried many others and the seal isn’t right. But the bottle that came in the box lost the ring off the bottom after first use! Didn’t even get to hand wash it before it broke! The replacement bottle is $20.00 a piece! Renders the whole unit almost useless- seems a cheaper alternative unit might have actually been a better buy?!?!
customer_reviews.author: S.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Elegant accessory
customer_reviews.text: We love the AARKE - it looks great on our counter, works like a charm, saves us a ton of empty plastic bottles, and works really well. It's great that it has no cords or clutter and we use it every day. Maybe more $$ than sodastream but it looks like it belongs on the kitchen counter. Well built.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sprague

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love it, no more seltzer bottles needed , great for environmental conscience people.. high bubble content makes for great Egg Creams
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Cost more to produce soda water than buying bottled soda water
customer_reviews.text: I am going through a canister of CO2 every week to get 8 litres of soda water. This is a big disappointment to me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. David E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working after 30 days it is horrible....How do I return it?
customer_reviews.author: xesus

customer_reviews.title: poorly made & disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This product looks great but it is made poorly so that it is constantly leaking CO 2. We've already had the product replaced once and the 2nd one is just as bad as the first. You end up replacing the canisters weekly regardless of how much use you get out of it which ends up costing more than just buying disposable cans or bottles of seltzer. It's a huge waste of money. It's surprising that such a simple product with ONE job to do falls so short especially when it's double the price of a standard Soda Stream.
customer_reviews.author: lx

customer_reviews.title: DELICATE, WON'T LAST LONG!
customer_reviews.text: This thing's handlebar wears out too easily. I thought there was a defect in the first one I bought, which broke after 2 weeks so I asked them to replace it. The new one came in and it broke a month later. This product "looks" like its the best on the market, but it doesn't stack up. Their product development team clearly didn't stress test this thing enough. I suppose this can last you 6 months if you are alone and drink every other day. But a household of 5 that refills two bottles twice a day broke this AARKE handle like a twig. SODA stream it is!
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: Well built, attractive, completely useless
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give Aarke a shot after my second Sodastream in ~3 years died. I like the way it looks, and it seems well built, but that's where the positives end. It's more difficult to use than a Sodastream because you must screw your bottle in, as opposed to simply pushing in. It also - anecdotally - feels like it goes through gas much faster than my sodastreams did. However by far the worst part for me is that it barely carbonates. If you prefer your beverages "lightly sparkling" this might work for you, but I'd avoid it if you prefer stronger carbonation like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Cope

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this carbonator over the holidays; it seemed pretty good for a while, but became gradually less effective at achieving good carbonation until it stopped working altogether. We put a fresh canister in, and it gave a loud hiss and almost completely depleted the canister. Checked to make sure everything was screwed in tight (canister, nozzle, bottle), but to no effect—it no longer works. Disappointing, as it looks nice on the countertop.
customer_reviews.author: David Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Glad I finally pulled the trigger on this.
customer_reviews.text: We've had an SodaStream in the past. It was fine, but it was plasticity, clunky, and looked really out of place in our modern kitchen. Worse, it just felt cheap and didn't seem like it would last. We gave it away to a friend. The Aarke is built like a beast. Very well engineered and looks like it belongs in my kitchen. Setup, use, and cleaning is stupid proof. I already find myself drinking almost twice as much water as before. (Fun thing to do instead of giving the kids soda is to mix 1/2 orange juice and 1/2 sparkling water. Mine scream for it.)
customer_reviews.author: Genebean

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Gas after 1 year - Can't use it anymore.
customer_reviews.text: We've had our Aarke for just a year and now it's leaking gas and doesn't work properly anymore. I searched for a long time to find what appeared to be a well-made product (not made of plastic) now I'm let down because it's failing after one year (literally). I've reached out to the manufacturer but haven't heard back as to how this can be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and attractive on the counter
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Ark now for a few weeks and am still pleased with it. I like how easy it is to use, and that it looks much more attractive on the counter than a soda stream and takes less space than the Kithen Aid soda maker option. My one wish would be that they would have a glass bottle option, however as I read in the manual they only use the plastic bottles and wont use glass due to the added weight.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Fritsch

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This makes water fizzier than any bottled fizzy water I've ever purchased. I once chilled a bottle of water in the freezer before making it max strength, and forgot about it at room temperature for a bit... when I went to open it the cap flew off. Aggressively fizzy, 10/10. Also check out soda sense for easy mail in CO2 refills. (The extra bottle I ordered had a faulty cap that broke, but the machine itself was flawless.)
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Torres

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: Looks better, works better than the plastic soda maker it replaced. The ONLY upside to the soda stream is the new way to insert the bottle without screwing it in. Other than that, this beats it hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My First- but very well made, and effective
customer_reviews.text: I like the metallic build, and the overall sturdiness. I initially thought I'd want more than one bottle (which I'm not sure how to buy.) You can't use any bottle, because the diameter and thread count require their bottle. I keep their bottle full of filtered water in fridge, and when I need more carbonated water, I blast it and transfer it to some glass bottles (can generally fill two small bottles from the AARKE bottle.)
customer_reviews.author: David D Van Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to break
customer_reviews.text: We got this after two of our Sodastream's broke just due to plastic parts (I mean, we use them multiple times a day and they broke after months/years) but have had this for months now with now issues. Having to screw on the bottles is a little annoying, but the lever is super fun - and anyway, just it not breaking is fantastic. Bubbles are great, too. Seem a bit different from Sodastream (maybe a bit less sharp?).
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: No fizz
customer_reviews.text: We tried and tried to get properly fizzy water, but what ever we tried we couldn't get it to work ver well. And yes, I was using a brand new cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money, leaks ridiculously. Loved the design and wanted something a little more premium looking than a plastic soda stream so went with the aarke. Leaked from day one, tried all the recommendations I found online but it just doesn’t stop. If they fixed this issue it would be the best choice for a great looking carbonation utility but it’s soooo frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CARBONATOR
customer_reviews.text: i had a soda stream for the past 15yrs and needed to replace it and saw this one which was made from all stainless and not plastic. this is the best and easiest carbonation machine i have used and i can see this will last for years. love it and would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: FOCHEF

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This is junk. It worked for 3 months. It quit carbonating the water so I changed cartridges and it still does not carbonate the water. I am not given a return option. I had a Soda stream that worked for YEARS. It FAR exceeds this product. DO NOT BUY unless you want to throw away $200+. PIECE OF JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Catlore

customer_reviews.title: Lovely, sturdy design and feel
customer_reviews.text: So far I absolutely love my new Aarke carbonator! I do feel it goes through canisters rather quickly, which bums me out but then again I have nothing to compare it to and we are still refining our use. I have found that a single "pump" of the handle carbonates really well, so this may improve. I purchased it because it is primarily made of metal instead of plastic and I associate that with good quality plus I'm really trying hard to minimize my purchases of plastics.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, we returned it
customer_reviews.text: The unit we got was faulty. It made a creaking sound when doing carbonation, and literally exhausted the entire 60L CO2 canister while carbonating 3 bottles. And of those 3 bottles only one bottle was carbonated well, the other 2 just so so. And then it stopped working. We returned it after trying to use it for 2 days. Looks beautiful, but manufacturing quality is poor.
customer_reviews.author: vired99

customer_reviews.title: LEAKING CO2 AFTER ONLY A FEW MONTHS OF USE!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this product up until a few weeks ago when it leaked an entire cartridge of c02 (which is not cheap!). I've been attempting to get a replacement Aarke but Amazon and Aarke are not responding. This is very disappointing given the cost of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lizabeth Bren

customer_reviews.title: No more waste
customer_reviews.text: It really is a very cool appliance to have on hand if you are a sparkling water drinker. Which I am. At least a bottle a day which results in a ton of waste. Something I try to avoid. The added bonus of being able to refill the canisters is great. I appreciate how well it is made. Certainly don’t want to have to buy another in a year or so. The only thing is I have no idea how long to hold down the lever to carbonate. I may run through my cylinders faster than expected. I really do love it.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: Necessity if you drink carbonated water often
customer_reviews.text: So nice to not have to buy carbonated water anymore. It tastes great and I even tested keeping a bottle I made in the fridge for a few days and it was still fresh and carbonated. Also the minimal counter space and sleek design is a major plus, especially in an apartment where space is limited. Such a great buy, don’t know how I went without this for so long.
customer_reviews.author: twinhamm3r

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and engineering of this product. It’s beautiful to look at and simple enough to use. Have had it for two weeks now and no issues thus far, mercifully! Enjoying my fizzy drinks without the clutter of plastics and cans! I would recommend getting an extra bottle to keep a steady available supply of chilled fizzy water. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: tasinmaine

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less then 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with my purchase but the unit stopped working within six months. I just put it away and figured I would try and see what could be done but never reached out to anyone. What can I do now since so much time has gone by? I really spent a lot of money on this. Does anyone know how to contact the company?
customer_reviews.author: Cindy J Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: The machine didn't actually carbonate water very well at all. We tried different things to improve it, but nothing worked. I would have returned it but we were past the return window. Real bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: cheap chinese product!beware
customer_reviews.text: What do you know....another cheap Chinese product! Definitely does not have the sturdiness that is depicted on the photos. Especially now in these times I will not support Chinese products, and you shouldn't either!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bye Lacroix
customer_reviews.text: my wife and I have had this for the last 2 months and we use this thing daily. We have 2 air canisters and are just now running out of air in the second one. We use it with filtered water and don’t even bother with the flavorings anymore it’s so good(except sometimes fresh lime slices - excellent). We always do 3 level pulls to charge our water. We used to drink so many cans of lacroix a day, but neither of us miss it! Many people have purchased this after coming to our house and trying our sparkling water.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Sustainable solution that tastes great
customer_reviews.text: We're addicted to San Pegrino and Perrier, buying multiple bottles per month... On top of the trash aspect, they are bottled overseas, so you can imagine how bad it was for our planet... This item is really easy to use, the water tastes great and has enough bubbles. Not mentioning it looks beautiful. We LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Franck and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bring ugly in my kitchen! Great Looking Product.
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a soda making machine ever since these types of gadgets hit the market. But I never want something in my kitchen that doesn’t look good enough to leave out and not be an eye sore. This is the best most design forward soda maker on the market and you will love having this beautiful thing to use and won’t mind having it sit out on your counters.
customer_reviews.author: MOC

customer_reviews.title: Bottle is not dishwasher safe - other bottles are not compatible.
customer_reviews.text: So the bottle that came with this device immediately melted in the dishwasher. I'd also ordered more glass bottles to go with it as these were recommended by Amazon to be commonly purchased with this device.  But the threads for the top of it are not compatible! I have not been able to find other bottles that work with this device yet and are dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.author: David Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Carbonation weak!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. Will not carbonate with fizz. Its relatively weak, no matter how much i blast it. The air escapes out of the top once it reaches a certain pressure. That carbonation level is like a flat soda. Has some fizz, but very weak. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Thelen

customer_reviews.title: Metal bottom to the water bottle has fallen off
customer_reviews.text: We do use and LOVE the Aarke. Can't get enough of it! My biggest issue is that the silver base has already detached from the bottle/decanter. I have not used in the dishwater, or freezer. I would think the bottle would have been more durable. Otherwise I do love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: DariaG

customer_reviews.title: Sexiest Sparkling Water Machine on Market
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I was tired of the cheap-looking, plastic Soda Stream brand options for making sparkling water. It is straightforward, easy to set up, and comes with an amusing-to-read user guide. Everyone who has seen it so far has gasped in delight; it's just that magnificent. Definitely worth the splurge.
customer_reviews.author: sariahjane

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought it was a step up from my 10 year old plastic soda stream. Build quality is very nice and it really looks great on the counter. Unfortunately it just doesn’t work very well. It takes much longer to carbonate a bottle than my old soda stream did. Honestly, I’m not impressed. Too bad, I really was excited about it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A Rockwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this soda maker! I really think it is better looking than a soda stream and seems more durable. It is sleek and looks great in my kitchen. It works well and I would recommend as a gift for anyone! It is great not to have to spend money on la croix anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Karyn Ard Katenkamp

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use than I expected
customer_reviews.text: My lovely wife is thrilled to have a more environmentally sensitive source of sparkling water. The AARKE- Carbonator is working well and looks good out on the counter. I hope it continues to perform as well in the future as it is now as a new device.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey 6f

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for soda stream
customer_reviews.text: I had a soda stream and used it every day. Had I known about this I would have returned it in under 24 hrs It is easy to use as it is well crafted and striking to look at in a modernist Scandanavian way. Much better than a soda stream, feels solid and durable
customer_reviews.author: rightONtime

customer_reviews.title: A marked improvement over the common plastic versions
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is "AARKE - what a beautiful machine!" Simple design, assembly - really none and easy functionality. It's an architectural plus to our kitchen. It's not dramatically more expensive than the plastic version, who's failure prompted getting the ARRKE, but wow what a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Hagen Finley

customer_reviews.title: Great product but missing a piece
customer_reviews.text: Lovely design and function but did not receive the bottom tray that was supposed to be included. Doesn’t effect function but would have been nice to have for aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: Peetu Melwani

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in January. However, the bottle was broken in February. I send an email to the seller but no answer.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but I think you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Looks very classy. Not quite as much fizz as bottled club soda from the store but has none of the additives. I use distilled water or filtered spring water. I keep a second bottle filled and ready to carbonate in the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Py Kolb

customer_reviews.title: Turned out to be a great gift for my wife!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, and makes well carbonated water that we are able to enjoy without throwing out so much waste when compared to buying cans of sparkling water at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love it - replaces Sodastream - 5 ways it’s way better
customer_reviews.text: Perfect form AND function We replaced our plastic Sodastream with the Aarke. Why? 1. Gorgeous. 2. No electricity needed; frees up a much needed appliance outlet (and we didn’t like having an electric appliance so close to the sink). 3. Not plastic. We’re omitting plastic from our household. 4. Uses all our existing Sodastream bottles. 5. Works great! And you can customize how much fizz you want (vs. the Sodastream default settings.). So... delicious fizzy water, with more ease and high style. A big thumbs up from us!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Smith

customer_reviews.title: worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: I'm leaking more co2 these days than I'm getting to use. It's pretty upsetting. Not sure what to do about it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than sodastream
customer_reviews.text: sleek, durable very modern, easier to use than sodastream and much sturdier. great design no mess or removal of a million plastic pieces, we love the aarke totally recommend it to anyone. fast delivery also
customer_reviews.author: athena

customer_reviews.title: This might be worth it if it actually connected to a full-size CO2 tank.
customer_reviews.text: I must have been out of my mind when I purchased this. This thing is extremely expensive for what it is. This is basically a soda stream. Like I said I don’t know what I was thinking. At the time I purchased this it was $165.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what we thought it would be and everything works well.
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what we thought it would be and everything works well. We have a wet bar and wanted something that looked nice but was also functionable. We have enjoyed it and it looks great on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cusick

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Bought two.
customer_reviews.text: Loved my chrome carbonator so much that I bought a gold one for another home. Looks great, doesn't' need power/batteries, and it's solidly build with metal parts.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Best Carbonator on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Spend the extra cash on this, over the SodaStream. No battery, easy pull lever. The instructions say the bottle is not dishwasher safe, but I have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: NZ84

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Our first one was not working right but Amazon quickly sent us a replacement and it works amazing! Looks alot better on the counter than the other brand ones, I got the stainless steel. It did cost twice as much as other brands but I'd say it's worth it because its much better to look at. We go through about a canister of air a week, but that's cause my fiancee drinks alot of soda water and extra carbinates his water everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easy add gas
customer_reviews.text: Gas arrives today. It looks good and matches the interior. Can be installed with sodastream or drink mate.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FIT FOR MY KITCHEN AND THE PLANET
customer_reviews.text: I used to drink 3 bottles of San Pelligrino and i was looking for a way to reduce my plastic consumption. This device is totally counter worthy, super easy to use, works with the Sodastream co2 canister. I used a brita filter first and then add the co2 and it's like 90% San Pelligrino.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: no tank
customer_reviews.text: for $199. you would think a tank would be included so I could make soda
customer_reviews.author: dini

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and practical
